description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING SINGLE STOREY GARAGE. ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION AND TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 64-01-100; -103; -101; -102; -401; -Sketch 3(B); Sketch 1(C); Sketch 2(C) received 30/10/2013.  Sketch 4(C) received 20/12/2013.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form, the drawings in condition 2 and the email received on 20/12/2013 specifying the external materials, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window or door, other than at ground floor level, other than those expressly authorised by this permission or dormer shall be constructed in the south east (side) elevation without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed on the north west (side) elevation without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE 
The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link:	
http://www.communities.gov.uk/documents/planningandbuilding/pdf/133214.pdf

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraphs 186 and 187 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive solution focused approach to development proposals. LBM works with applicants and agents in a positive and proactive manner by offering a pre-application advice, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome and updating applicants/agents of any issues which arise in the processing of their application.  In this instance, the applicant was given the opportunity to submit amended plans to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms, and the application was approved within the statutory target timescale.
